questions.question: Transponders are required in order to fly in airspace designated as __________ __________ (TM).

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.247 - Use of transponder and altitude reporting equipment)

questions.question: An aircraft required to have a transponder installed shall not be flown unless the transponder has been tested and inspected within the preceding _____ months.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.605(e)(3) - Maintenance programmes and schedules.

questions.question: An aircraft may not be refuelled or defuelled with Class 3.1A (AVGAS - piston engine aircraft) when passengers are __________, __________, or __________ the aircraft, or ____________________.
questions.answer: Embarking. On board. Dis-embarking. When the engine(s) is running.

questions.question: Under Part 91, an aircraft may not be refuelled or defuelled with Class 3.1C (Jet A1) or Class 3.1D (diesel) when passengers are __________, __________, or __________ the aircraft. The engine (may/may not) be running during refuelling or defuelling.
What should you do in the case of fuel spillage on an an impermeable surface?
questions.answer: Cease fuelling. Immediately cover the fuel with sand, sawdust, foam, or similar material. Move the aircraft away from the contaminated area prior to engine start if there's a risk to safety.

questions.question: What is a Class B cargo or baggage compartment?
questions.answer: A compartment that's accessible in flight such that a crew member can reach any part with a fire extinguisher, and has a fire warning system installed.
